pr_title: Changed TypeTokenContainer from interface to class

timeline.message: Changed TypeTokenContainer from interface to class

timeline.body: suggestion: Since `TypeTokenContainer` is immutable, let's have a singleton `TypeTokenContainer .EMPTY` instance that can be shared by all non-generic classes as opposed to allocating one each time.
timeline.bodyText: suggestion: Since TypeTokenContainer is immutable, let's have a singleton TypeTokenContainer .EMPTY instance that can be shared by all non-generic classes as opposed to allocating one each time.
timeline.bodyHTML: suggestion: Since TypeTokenContainer is immutable, let's have a singleton TypeTokenContainer .EMPTY instance that can be shared by all non-generic classes as opposed to allocating one each time.
timeline.author: vkryachko

timeline.body: Consider moving the conversion logic `Type->TypeToken` into the TypeToken class itself, this would increase cohesion of this class and will not require making `TypeToken#of(Type)` non-private, effectively exposing its implementation details.
timeline.bodyText: Consider moving the conversion logic Type->TypeToken into the TypeToken class itself, this would increase cohesion of this class and will not require making TypeToken#of(Type) non-private, effectively exposing its implementation details.
timeline.bodyHTML: Consider moving the conversion logic Type->TypeToken into the TypeToken class itself, this would increase cohesion of this class and will not require making TypeToken#of(Type) non-private, effectively exposing its implementation details.
timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: Also might make sense to make the constructor public and class final.
replies.author: vkryachko

timeline.body: I think `IllegalArgumentException` is more appropriate here.
timeline.bodyText: I think IllegalArgumentException is more appropriate here.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think IllegalArgumentException is more appropriate here.
timeline.author: vkryachko

timeline.body: nit: what if the index is less than zero?
timeline.bodyText: nit: what if the index is less than zero?
timeline.bodyHTML: nit: what if the index is less than zero?

timeline.body: Doesn't this produce an unchecked cast warning? if so worth adding a `@SuppressWarnings`?

timeline.bodyHTML: Doesn't this produce an unchecked cast warning? if so worth adding a @SuppressWarnings?
